description: Pharmacy First pathway for non-bullous and bullous impetigo management in community pharmacy.
inclusion: Patients aged 1 year and over with suspected impetigo lesions.
Localized or widespread lesions of less than 14 days duration.
No systemic illness or deep tissue involvement.
exclusion: Signs of systemic illness, cellulitis, or sepsis.
Periorbital involvement or suspicion of ecthyma.
Recurrent MRSA infections or post-operative wound infections.
safetyNetting: Seek urgent care if fever, rapidly spreading redness, or systemic symptoms develop.
Return if lesions worsen or fail to improve within 7 days of treatment.
Advise on hygiene measures to limit spread and avoid school/work until lesions crust.

pass.label: Age within Pharmacy First impetigo range.

fail.label: Impetigo pathway excludes infants under 1 year.

result.headline: Refer - patient under 1 year
result.summary: Neonates with suspected impetigo require GP/paediatric review.
actions: Arrange urgent GP assessment for neonate.

warnings: Clarify penicillin allergy status before supplying oral antibiotics.

pass.label: Red flag infection signs - urgent referral required.

result.headline: Urgent referral - suspected cellulitis or sepsis
result.summary: Escalate immediately due to rapidly spreading or systemic infection signs.
actions: Arrange urgent care or 999 assessment depending on severity.

pass.label: Periorbital impetigo - refer for medical review.

result.headline: Urgent referral - periorbital involvement
result.summary: Risk of orbital complications requires same-day medical assessment.

result.headline: Refer - immunocompromise is an exclusion
result.summary: Requires GP oversight due to higher complication risk.
actions: Arrange GP review and provide hygiene advice pending assessment.

outcomes.description: Oral antibiotics required with penicillin allergy

result.headline: Supply Clarithromycin for 7 days
result.summary: Widespread/bullous disease requires oral therapy with penicillin allergy noted.
actions: Supply Clarithromycin 250 mg twice daily for 7 days (adjust paediatric dose).
Advise adherence, hygiene measures, and wound care.

supply.dosage: Take 250 mg twice daily for 7 days (paediatric dose weight adjusted)

result.headline: Supply Flucloxacillin for 7 days
result.summary: Widespread/bullous disease requires oral therapy with first-line penicillin.
actions: Supply Flucloxacillin 500 mg four times daily for 7 days (paediatric dose weight adjusted).
Provide hygiene advice and wound care instructions.
Document safety netting and advise follow-up if no improvement in 48 hours.

supply.product: Flucloxacillin 500 mg capsules or oral solution
supply.dosage: Take 500 mg four times daily for 7 days (paediatric dose weight adjusted)
supply.notes: Take on an empty stomach; check for hepatic dysfunction history.

pass.label: Localized disease - supply topical fusidic acid.

result.headline: Supply Fusidic acid 2% cream for 5 days
result.summary: Localized non-bullous impetigo suitable for topical therapy.
actions: Supply Fusidic acid 2% cream apply three times daily for 5 days.
Advise on hygiene, hand washing, and covering lesions.

supply.dosage: Apply thinly to affected area three times daily for 5 days
supply.notes: Stop treatment once lesions healed; reassess if no improvement in 5 days.
